bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Jacob Schuman. Abstract of Cost
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Abstract cost continuance Sheriffs Fees J.H. Hosler July 27 Serving Warrant 1.20 1 day of court with persons 3.00 2 Subpoenas served 1.20 Aug 7 1 day of court with persons 3.00 " 16 1 day of court with persons 3.00 2 Commitments 2.00 $13.40
Witness Fees (For Territory) A.L. McCauley 4 days and 8 miles 8.80 Geo V. Crosslir 4 " and 8 " 8.8"

Justice's Fees J.C. Dorr Affidavit and Warrant 1.25 Entering docket tax costs 1.00 2 Subpoenas .30 adjournment to 29th .30 Taking Recognizance of Bail 1.00 July 29 continuance to 2 o'clock .50 " " Adjournment to Aug 2nd .50 August 2 on " 9th .50 " " Commitment .50 " 7 Taking Recognizance of Bail 1.00 " " Certificate of Discharge from Com. 1.00 " 9 adjournment to Aug 16 .50 " 16 2 Witnesses sworn .30 Judgment Satisfaction 1.00 Commitment .50 Taking Recognizance 2 Witnesses 2.00 12 papers filed in all 1.80 Extra in docket 8 1.60 this namescript 11 2.20 Certificate 1.00 $19.15

I, J.C. Dorr one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, do hereby certify that the foregoing is a true and complete transcript of all the proceedings had before me in the case of the Territory of Wash- ington against Jacob Schuman charged with violation of the Local Option Law on July 27th 1886 in Dayton Precinct, that the hereunto annexed are the papers of the said case and that the accompanying abstract of cost is correct to the best of my knowledge
Given under my hand this 16th day of August 1886 J.C. Dorr
